column1: #Text='More than 1,000 of the newcomers are living in temporary housing.
#Text=And we still have a shortage of family doctors, a lack of proper dental care for low-income adults and a lack of subsidized daycare spaces for parents...'
#Text=Meanwhile, by some estimates 200,000 Canadian are either homeless or insecurely housed.
#Text=And hundreds of thousands more pay in excess of 50% of the income on rent and are a paycheque away from eviction.
#Text=There is no right to housing in Canada for Canadians.
#Text=Why should there be such a right for others?
#Text=As for medical care, millions of Canadians lack a family doctor and millions of low-income Canadians have no access to affordable dental care.
#Text=And daycare availability is spotty, to say the least.
#Text=Canada is in the bottom third of OECD countries in social program spending calculated as a percentage of GDP.
#Text=It's not a very generous country to its own disadvantaged citizens.
#Text=Sorry, but that's the way it is.
